intro: Aethionema ozbekii, commonly known as the Turkmenian sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species of mustard and cabbage. This shrub is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and has a low-growing habit.
